articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The tanker is reportedly linked to Israel, and the strike follows Houthi attacks on Red Sea ships.
articles.title: India drone strike: Cargo ship attacked off Gujarat coast

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: HMS Trent will visit South America as a show of support for the former British colony, the BBC learns.
articles.title: Guyana: UK to send warship to South America amid Venezuela tensions

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: An Israeli army spokesman says fierce battles are raging at Hamas's new strongholds in the Gaza Strip.
articles.title: Israel vows to continue 'difficult' military operation in Gaza

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.description: American Deontay Wilder suffers a shock points loss to Joseph Parker in Saudi Arabia, scuppering plans for the long-awaited heavyweight blockbuster with Anthony Joshua next year.
articles.title: Joshua wins in style but Wilder suffers shock loss

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Kelsey Hatcher has given birth in Alabama twice in two days - after a 'one in a million' pregnancy.
articles.title: Watch: Joy as babies born to mum with rare double womb

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The former member of the US country music band dies after being involved in a two-vehicle crash in Texas.
articles.title: Dixie Chicks band founding member Laura Lynch dies in car crash

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Dozens of others were injured at the Chinese-funded facility, after a flammable liquid ignited.
articles.title: Explosion at Indonesia nickel plant kills 13 staff

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A former TV journalist is barred from standing by officials due to "mistakes" on her application form.
articles.title: Russia bans anti-war candidate from challenging Putin

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: From giant glowing figures in Colombia to spinning projections in Australia the world's cities are embracing Christmas.
articles.title: A tour round the world's Christmas lights

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Flags fly at half-mast on a day of national mourning after 14 people were killed in Prague on Thursday.
articles.title: Czech Republic mourns victims of Prague university mass shooting
